comment: DO NOT TAKE unless you're ready to go to class to not get taught.  If you don't go to class, you will not pass.  Participation questions and group worksheets are given.  Seems as if she makes it much harder than it would be if she taught.

Prof. Sutherland was a good teacher. Friendly, and respectful of students. Good lectures, but it is important that you always show up to class. Participation matters. Lots of homework, but most of it was not too hard. Tests were hard though. As long as you showed up to class each day, and payed attention, you have a pretty good chance of passing.
Tests are HORRIBLE. Go over power-point in class, but seems like there's nothing in it on the test. Going to office hours for content help is pointless. Nice person, wouldn't recommend as a teacher
Outstanding teacher. Her class required hard work and attendance to make a good grade, but if you pay attention you will succeed
She did a great job disputed being a little handicapped from her accident. Stick it out and work hard and you will do well.
She is a terrible teacher that I would never take again. I would rather have added another year to my school then have taken her.

Exams are extremely difficult. She reads from the powerpoint, and she only spends 5 secs on the basics of the concept before moving on to advance concept examples. Read and study the book (including ALL the concept and CYU problems) and you should pass though because recitation assignments and homework totals 25% of the grade.
good professor , i would take her again

During lecture she talked very monotone and ppts are verbatim from the book. Its your job to teach yourself. Not very helpful. She pushes students to learn the concepts of Phys rather than doing prob's. Tests were made up of 20 impossible concept Q's and 3 prob's, always tricky. Required to do online HW and come to recitation for a quiz every week.
